doc.title: China International Capital (3908.HK)
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-30/China International Capital 3908.HK 2Q25 beat pre-announcement on strong prop trading and IBD valuation offers attractiv_2025-08-30

passages.text: **2Q25 beat pre-announcement, strong** **pro** **trading and IBD;**
**valuation offers attractive upside option**

CICC reported 1H25 NPAT of RMB4.3bn, up +94.4% y-y, notably higher vs.pre-announcement (+55%-78% y-y), forming c.58% of FY25 consensus estimate. 2Q25 was strong +24.6% q-q/+42.5% y-y, thanks to robust proptrading (+13.5% q-q/+60.9% y-y). 2Q25 NPAT came in even faster, up +12.1% q-q/+131.3% y-y to reach RMB2.29bn, driven by better CIR (-17.5ppt y-y). ROA/ROE were up +0.68ppt/+4.0ppt y-y to 1.33%/7.8% in 2Q25. Leverage up from 5.75x in 1Q25 to 5.89x in 2Q25, while core leverage was flattish q-q at 4.83x in 2Q25. Despite the strong earnings, CICC maintained interim DPS of RMB0.09 in 1H25 (flat y-y), implying a payout ratio of 10% (-9.5ppt y-y).

**Key positives — Brokerage commission** solid, +4.3% q-q/+44.2% y-y in 2Q25,outperforming ADT downtrend in A-shr market to RMB1.23tn in 2Q25 (-17.7% q-q/+48.9% y-y), indicating likely market share gain. **Prop** **trading** income came in better-than-expected, +13.5% q-q/+60.9% y-y in 2Q25, likely thanks to both favorable bond market conditions and ongoing equity market rally (w/SHCOMP/CSI300/ChiNext up +3.3%/+1.3%/+2.3% q-q in 2Q25). IBD revenue jumped notably, +213.6% q-q/+52.3% y-y to account for 17.8% of revenue in 2Q25 (+10.7ppt q-q/+1.3ppt y-y), likely due to strength in HK IPO, while solid bond underwriting biz also helped (bond underwriting volume +36% y-y in 2Q, per Wind data). Asset mgmt. biz revenue improved, +2.8x q-q/+9.3% y-y in 2Q25, possibly thanks to improved investor sentiment in 2Q, with decent broker AUM growth of +8% h-h in 1H25. **Provision write-back** of RMB31mn was recorded in 2Q25 (much larger vs. write back of RMB4mn in 2Q24), likely thanks to better-than-expected recovery rate on MFSL biz amid more stable equity market conditions in 2Q. **CIR** improved notably, -17.5ppt y-y to 62.1% in 2Q25, mainly due to revenue strength (+42.5% y-y in 2Q), while OPEX growth was kept under control (by +11.1% in 2Q25).(Continued)
Source: Powered by dataCentral
Target price HK$19.43
Expected share price return -8.3%
Expected dividend yield 1.2%
Expected total return -7.0%
Market Cap HK$102,241M
**Price Performance**

Citi Research is a division of Citigroup Global Markets Inc. (the "Firm"), which does and seeks to do business with companies covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the Firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision. Certain products (not inconsistent with the author's published research) are available only on Citi's portals.

**Key negatives** — Net interest expense increased +53% y-y to RMB336mn in 2Q25, mainly due to lower interest income (-11.1% y-y in 2Q25), likely due to reduced MFSL interest rate (-20bp h-h to 5% in 1H25 by our estimate), more than offsetting the positive from lower interest expense (-5.4% y-y in 2Q25, possibly thanks to lower interbank rates in 2Q). Effective tax increased to 16.5% in 2Q25 (+12.9ppt y-y), mainly due to low base.

**Implications:** We expect market to react positively to CICC's strong 1H25 earnings growth of +94.4% y-y, which is notably higher vs. pre-announcement (+55%-78% y-y). With HK IPO market rebound, we see CICC best positioned benefit from potential IPO revenue uplift and improved investor sentiment on the stock. In addition, we also see CICC well-positioned as a key beneficiary of ongoing regulatory effort to drive broker sector supply side reform/ consolidation via M&A. CICC-H currently trade at 12.4x 26E P/E and 0.66x 26E P/B, which is much cheaper vs. other H-shr market proxy such as HKEX/Futu, which trade at 36x/ 20.1x 26E P/E.
Figure 1. CICC 2Q25 at a glance
**Issued shares (mn)**
2025 Citigroup Inc. No redistribution without Citigroup's written permission.
Source: Citi Research, Company data

China International Capital Corporation (CICC), founded in Jul 1995, is China's first joint- venture securities firm positioned as the pioneer of investment banking in the country. Following its listing on the main board of the Hong Kong Stock Exchange in 2015, CICC's A shares were listed on the Main Board of Shanghai Stock Exchange in 2020. In Apr 2017, CICC acquired a \(100\%\) stake in China Investment Securities Company (CISC), and consolidated its then wealth management unit and CISC into a newly- established wealth mgmt. brand "CICC Wealth Management" in Aug 2019. Headquartered in Beijing, CICC has built deep Chinese roots with over 200 domestic branches across 28 provinces and municipalities nationwide, and international reach with offices in major international financial centers.

We rate CICC H- share Buy / High Risk (1H). CICC's key competitive advantages include valuable brand recognition in the IBD business, a strong institutional customer base, well- recognized investment and research capabilities, solid relationships with SOEs, SMEs and new economies companies, and strong overseas presence that allows it to offer one- stop cross- border services. As a top- tier securities firm in China, CICC looks well- positioned to benefit from the positive longer- term sector outlook, with multiple tailwinds including: 1) potential Chinese ADRs "homecoming" listing to A- share/ H- share markets; 2) China's capital market reform with stronger push for direct financing; 3) potential full adoption of registration- based IPO system; 4) household asset re- allocation towards equity/ funds; 5) institutionalization and internationalization trends in the A- share market; and 6) further opening up of the derivatives market, etc.

We value CICC- H on a three- stage GGM with a target price of \(\mathsf{HK}\updownarrow 19.43\) implying 0.70x FY25E P/B. Our three- stage GGM method's assumptions are: (i) High growth phase based on our explicit forecasts for 2024- 26E - during this period, we effectively assume an average ROE of \(5.9\%\) and a dividend payout ratio of \(14.7\%\) ; (ii) 7- year growth phase in 2027- 2033E - during this period, we assume an average ROE of \(15.8\%\) and a dividend payout ratio of \(20\%\) ; (iii) Terminal phase assumes an average ROE of \(17\%\) and a dividend payout ratio of \(30\%\) . We assume a COE of \(17.9\%\) for all three stages.

We rate CICC- H shares High Risk given the volatility in the market. Key downside risks that could prevent the stock from reaching our target price are: (i) a weaker- than- expected A- share market, which would drag down earnings and sentiment toward China's securities firms; (ii) slower economic growth in China, which would affect social wealth and equity market performance; (iii) setbacks for financial reforms; (iv) intensifying competition from domestic giant brokers, Internet finance players, Sino- foreign joint venture securities firms and wholly foreign- owned securities firms, which
may weigh on underwriting and brokerage fee rate; and (v) higher-than- expected credit risks to counterparties in the case of credit events.

Citi Research stock recommendations include an investment rating and an optional risk rating to highlight high risk stocks. Risk rating takes into account both price volatility and fundamental criteria. Stocks will either have no risk rating or a High risk rating assigned.

Investment Ratings: Citi Research investment ratings are Buy, Neutral and Sell. Our ratings are a function of analyst expectations of expected total return ("ETR") and risk. ETR is the sum of the forecast price appreciation (or depreciation) plus the dividend yield for a stock within the next 12 months. The target price is based on a 12 month time horizon. The Investment rating definitions are: Buy (1) ETR of \(15\%\) or more or \(25\%\) or more for High risk stocks; and Sell (3) for negative ETR. Any covered stock not assigned a Buy or a Sell is a Neutral (2). For stocks rated Neutral (2), if an analyst believes that there are insufficient valuation drivers and/or investment catalysts to derive a positive or negative investment view, they may elect with the approval of Citi Research management not to assign a target price and, thus, not derive an ETR. Citi Research may suspend its rating and target price and assign "Rating Suspended" status for regulatory and/or internal policy reasons. Citi Research may also suspend its rating and target price and assign "Under Review" status for other exceptional circumstances (e.g. lack of information critical to the analyst's thesis, trading suspension) affecting the company and/or trading in the company's securities. In both such situations, the rating and target price will show as "—" and "—" respectively in the rating history price chart. Prior to 11 April 2022 Citi Research assigned "Under Review" status to both situations and prior to 11 Nov 2020 only in exceptional circumstances. As soon as practically possible, the analyst will publish a note re- establishing a rating and investment thesis. Investment ratings are determined by the ranges described above at the time of initiation of coverage, a change in investment and/or risk rating, or a change in target price (subject to limited management discretion). At times, the expected total returns may fall outside of these ranges because of market price movements and/or other short- term volatility or trading patterns. Such interim deviations will be permitted but will become subject to review by Research Management. Your decision to buy or sell a security should be based upon your personal investment objectives and should be made only after evaluating the stock's expected performance and risk.

Catalyst Watch and STV Upside/Downside calls: Citi Research may also include a Catalyst Watch or STV Upside or Downside call to indicate the analyst expects the share price to rise (fall) in absolute terms over a specified period of 30 or 90 days in reaction to one or more specific near- term catalysts or events impacting the company or the market. A Catalyst Watch will be published when Analyst confidence is high that an impact to share price will occur; it will be a STV when confidence level is moderate. A Catalyst Watch or STV Upside/Downside call will automatically expire at the end of the specified 30/90 day period. The Catalyst Watch will also be automatically removed if share price performance (calculated at market close) exceeds \(15\%\) against the direction of the call (unless over- ridden by the analyst). The analyst may also remove a Catalyst Watch or STV call prior to the end of the specified period in a published research note. A Catalyst Watch/STV Upside or Downside call may be different from and does not affect a stock's fundamental equity rating, which reflects a longer- term total absolute return

expectation. For purposes of FINRA ratings- distribution- disclosure rules, a Catalyst Watch/STV Upside call corresponds to a buy recommendation and a Catalyst Watch/STV Downside call corresponds to a sell recommendation. Any stock not assigned to a Catalyst Watch Upside, Catalyst Watch Downside, STV Upside, or STV Downside call is considered Catalyst Watch/STV No View. For purposes of FINRA ratings distribution- disclosure rules, we correspond Catalyst Watch/STV No View to Hold in our ratings distribution table for our Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside rating system. However, we reiterate that we do not consider No View to be a recommendation. For all Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside calls, risk exists that the catalyst(s) and associated share- price movement will not materialize as expected.
